annotations.description: The players of both teams deserve praise from their managers and supporters for their performance on the pitch. If they carry on playing this exciting brand of football in future games, then the fans will surely be right behind them. There wasn't any significant dominance by either side in this game. The home team tried to find the weakness in the opposition's defence mostly using rapid counter attacks, while the away team played possession football.

Francisco Casilla gets a well deserved ovation! Rodrigo (Valencia) produces a decent first time strike towards the left post, but the goalkeeper is positioned well to block it. Nice goalkeeping skills. Good work from Valencia as they win a corner.

annotations.label: corner
annotations.description: The resulting corner from Toni Kroos (Real Madrid) only finds one of the defenders, who heads it out of danger.

annotations.label: injury
annotations.description: Lucas (Real Madrid) is writhing in pain and can now receive medical treatment after the referee decides to stop play.

annotations.description: Rodrigo (Valencia) quickly takes the corner kick with a short pass.

annotations.label: corner
annotations.description: Santi Mina (Valencia) puts a cross into the box from the corner but there is no panic from the opposition and they easily clear.

Daniel Parejo (Valencia) latches on to a pin point pass on the edge of the box and unleashes a daisy cutter shot towards the bottom left corner, but the goalkeeper produces an amazing acrobatic dive to deny him. The ball bounces off his gloves and hits the post. Corner kick. Valencia will have an opportunity.

annotations.label: soccer-ball
annotations.description: Goal Cristiano Ronaldo (Real Madrid)! Cristiano Ronaldo (Real Madrid) was put through by James Rodriguez and he showed brilliant composure to tuck it home from inside the box. 3:1.
Lucas (Real Madrid) latches on to a precise pass and one on one with the keeper slams the ball towards the right hand post. Diego Alves is alert, though, and leaps like a salmon to deny him.

annotations.label: soccer-ball
annotations.description: The ball rebounds and arrives at the feet of Rodrigo (Valencia) just outside the box. He doesn't think twice and fires a shot towards the middle of the goal, which Francisco Casilla was unable to keep it out. 2:0.
Andre Gomes (Valencia) creates himself some space and attempts to put the ball into the box. However, the defender gets an important foot in to clear.

Wow, what an escape. Karim Benzema (Real Madrid) has an effort from inside the box but it's brilliantly blocked.
Daniel Parejo (Valencia) takes the resulting free kick from the edge of the box. His rocket of a shot crashes against the crossbar! What a shot.

annotations.label: y-card
annotations.description: This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Casemiro (Real Madrid) was quite harsh and David Fernandez Borbalan didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card. Valencia win a free kick. It's a promising situation for a direct shot.
The game is interrupted as Cristiano Ronaldo (Real Madrid) is flagged offside.

That was a brilliant piece of goalkeeping! Diego Alves dived superbly to block a header by Karim Benzema (Real Madrid) from around the penalty spot. His effort was directed straight towards the right post, but Diego Alves pulled off a remarkable save!
Casemiro (Real Madrid) collects a pass and finds himself in a good position to strike from the edge of the box, but his attempt is blocked.

annotations.label: substitution

annotations.label: whistle
annotations.description: David Fernandez Borbalan blows his whistle and the second half starts.

There was certainly plenty of action during that opening 45 minutes. The home side were more active and dominant in the first half. The opposition found it tough to keep up. The home team makes a lot of passes and attempts to maintain possession. The same goes for the away side.

annotations.label: soccer-ball
annotations.description: Goal! A mistake from the defence gifted a chance to a lurking Karim Benzema (Real Madrid), who keeps his cool and rolls the ball into the net from close range. 2:0.

Karim Benzema (Real Madrid) was close to scoring a goal after unleashing a first time effort from inside the six yard box. The ball was aimed towards the middle of the net, but the goalkeeper read it well and pulled off a brilliant save to thwart the attempt.

Cristiano Ronaldo (Real Madrid) collects a brilliant pass inside the box and finds himself in a goal scoring opportunity. He takes a shot, but the effort is well blocked by one of the defending players.

Diego Alves pulls off a fantastic save! Lucas (Real Madrid) attempts to head home after a precise cross into the box. He aims his header low towards the right post, but the effort is kept out. The ball goes out of play and Real Madrid have been awarded a corner kick.

Today's clash hasn't been that attractive up to now, but it hasn't been a total borefest. There have been a few nice movements for both sides.

The players of both teams deserve praise from their managers and supporters for their performance on the pitch. If they carry on playing this exciting brand of football in future games, then the fans will surely be right behind them. There wasn't any significant dominance by either side in this game. The home team tried to find the weakness in the opposition's defence mostly using rapid counter attacks, while the away team played possession football.
